de.systemagmbh.tools.io
Class CSysFile

java.lang.Object
  java.io.File
      de.systemagmbh.tools.io.CSysFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Serializable
public final class CSysFile
extends File

An enhanced File. Many of the methods found here were formerly in the same or other form in CSysFileTool.

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $

Christian Wohanka

lastModified

public String lastModified(SimpleDateFormat df)
Returns the formatted time that the file denoted by this abstract pathname was last modified.

Parameters:
df - a SimpleDateFormat
Returns:
A String value representing the df formatted time the file was last modified, measured in milliseconds since the epoch (00:00:00 GMT, January 1, 1970), or 0L if the file does not exist or if an I/O error occurs

lastModified

public String lastModified(String pattern)
Returns the formatted time that the file denoted by this abstract pathname was last modified.

Parameters:
pattern - a pattern that applies to SimpleDateFormat
Returns:
A String value representing the pattern formatted time the file was last modified, measured in milliseconds since the epoch (00:00:00 GMT, January 1, 1970), or 0L if the file does not exist or if an I/O error occurs

public CSysFile getRenamed(String dest)
Renames the physical file denoted by this abstract pathname and return a new CSysFile Object that's abstract pathname points to the renamed file.

Parameters:
dest - The new abstract pathname for the named file
Returns:
a CSysFile representing the name of the physical renamed file or null if the physical renaming was not successful.

renameTo

public boolean renameTo(File dest)
Renames ONLY THE PHYSICAL file denoted by this abstract pathname. Using this method is exactly the same as using File.renameTo(java.io.File).
The behaviour is a little bit tricky and not as anyone would expect, so here is an example that shows what really happens. There is also a discussion about the issue at the SUN java bug database, bug id 4094022

The program fragment

File file_1 = new File("C:/file_1.test");
file_1.createNewFile();
System.out.println(file_1);
System.out.println(file_1.renameTo(new File("C:/file_2.test")));
System.out.println(file_1.isFile());
System.out.println(file_1);

produces (with JDK 1.3.1_09) the following output

C:\file_1.test
true
false
C:\file_1.test
and leaves only C:\file_2.test on the disk.

That means that the physical file was renamed, but the abstract path name of the File Object representing it was not changed. Many people would expect that both, physical filename and the abstract pathname of the representing File Object will be changed, but according to SUN it will not. So be aware of this if you use the mechanism. This class provides a safer method of renaming which is getRenamed(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
dest - The new abstract pathname for the named file
Returns:
true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise

getSubdirectories

public CSysFile[] getSubdirectories()
Returns an array of CSysFiles containing the directories in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname.

Returns:
An array of abstract pathnames denoting the directories in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if this abstract pathname does not denote a directory, or if an I/O error occurs.

getFiles

public CSysFile[] getFiles()
Returns an array of CSysFiles containing the files in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname.

Returns:
An array of abstract pathnames denoting the files in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if this abstract pathname does not denote a directory, or if an I/O error occurs.

contains

public boolean contains(String sequence,
                        String encoding)
                 throws IOException
Check if this file contains a String. If you want to use the platforms default encoding determine it by System.getProperty("file.encoding");

Parameters:

encoding - the character encoding of the file
Returns:
true if the file contains the sequence, false otherwise
Throws:

replace

public void replace(String find,
                    String replace,
                    String encoding)
             throws IOException
Replace all occurrences of a String by another String. This method uses the CSysStringTool.replaceWord(String, String, String) method for the replacement operations.
To perform the whole task, the original file will be renamed to *.bak. After renaming the replacement process starts processing the data of the *.bak file and thus (re)creates the original file containing the replaced content. If this succeeds, the *.bak file will be deleted. If you want to use the platforms default encoding determine it by System.getProperty("file.encoding");

Parameters:
find - String to find
replace - String which should replace find String.
encoding - the character encoding of the file
Throws:
IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
